alert.note: Alert for Central Aleutians (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 27 at 5:35AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...STRONG FRONT TO BRING SNOW, BLOWING SNOW, AND MIXED PRECIPITATION TO CENTRAL ALEUTIANS TONIGHT... A strong front will move east across the Aleutians today, bringing strong southerly winds, snow, blowing snow and some rain to Adak and Atka. Cold air ahead of the front should lead to snow as the initial precipitation type as the front reaches Adak around 7pm followed by Atka around 9pm. Strong southerly winds will likely keep air temperatures between 32 and 36 degrees, leading to wet snow falling in southerly winds up to 55 mph. Snow will likely have difficulty drifting at sea level due to warmer temperatures, but even a slight increase in elevation will make blowing snow more likely. As precipitation comes to an end between midnight and 3am, expect a brief change over to rain or a rain snow mix as temperatures reach their peak. Visibility may be reduced to less than one half mile at times due to the strong wind and falling snow.
